org.cfpm.factbaseExtension
Class FactBase

java.lang.Object
  org.cfpm.factbaseExtension.FactBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.nlogo.api.ExtensionObject
public class FactBase
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.nlogo.api.ExtensionObject

This class implements the data type "fact base" that the factbase extension provides. A fact base can be thought of as a table with named columns ("fields"), where each row represents an entry ("fact"). At creation, the user has to define the structure of the fact base, that means define the field names. Note that in keeping with the NetLogo philosophy of a type-free language, data types for fields are not specified. After creating a fact base, facts can be asserted, queried and retracted. Facts are represented as lists of values, with one value for each field and all values in the same order as defined by the list of field names. Duplicate facts are not allowed. Therefore, trying to assert a fact with all values identical to an already existing fact is ignored. To be able to use indexing (and thus, faster retrieval), each fact is internally assigned an ID, starting with 0. A new fact will be assigned the highest number so far in use + 1. Retracting a fact will result in its ID being unassigned, thus trying to retrieve a retracted fact will generate an error.

Author:
Ruth Meyer

Field Detail

showDump

public static boolean showDump
Flag to toggle output to the console. Default is false; set to true only for debugging purposes.

Constructor Detail

FactBase

public FactBase()
Default "empty" constructor. Since no field names are given, just one field is created called "unnamed".

Constructor which defines the structure of the new fact base.

Parameters:
fields - the list of field names

size

public int size()
Returns the size of this fact base, that means the number of facts it contains.

Returns:
number of facts in this fact base

getFieldNames

public java.lang.String[] getFieldNames()
Returns the list of field names defining the structure of this fact base

getFieldIndex

public int getFieldIndex(java.lang.String fieldName)
Returns the position (index) of the given field name within the list of field names. Positions are between 0 and n-1. If there is no such field name defined for this fact base, returns -1.

Parameters:
fieldName - a field name
Returns:
index of the given field name or -1, if the field name does not exist

getField

protected java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.Object,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> getField(int index)
Returns the whole field ("column of the table") with the given index as a linked hash map. The field values are used as keys, with lists of corresponding fact IDs as values in this hash map.

Parameters:
index - index specifying which field to access
Returns:
the field as a linked hash map

assertFact

public int assertFact(java.util.List<java.lang.Object> fact)
               throws org.nlogo.api.ExtensionException
Asserts the given fact to this fact base. If an identical fact already exists in this fact base, nothing happens.

Parameters:
fact - the new fact to be inserted into the fact base
Returns:
the ID for the new fact (or the identical old fact)
Throws:
org.nlogo.api.ExtensionException - is thrown if the fact does not match the structure of this fact base (too many or too few fields)

removeFact

public void removeFact(java.util.List<java.lang.Object> fact)
                throws org.nlogo.api.ExtensionException
Removes the given fact from the fact base. This includes removing its field value/ID associations from all the internal fields and removing the fact from the list of ordered facts. If the fact is not contained in the fact base, nothing happens.

Parameters:
fact - the fact to be removed
Throws:
org.nlogo.api.ExtensionException - if the given fact's structure does not match the structure of the fact base

containsFact

public int containsFact(java.util.List<java.lang.Object> fact)
                 throws org.nlogo.api.ExtensionException
Checks if the given fact is contained within this fact base. If so, returns its fact ID. If not, returns -1.

Parameters:
fact - the fact to be checked
Returns:
the fact's ID (or -1 if the fact is not found in the fact base)
Throws:
org.nlogo.api.ExtensionException - if more than one fact identical to the given facts are found (which should not happen!)

isRetracted

public boolean isRetracted(int id)
Returns true if the fact with the given ID has been retracted. Otherwise, returns false.

Parameters:
id - a fact ID to be checked
Returns:
true, if the fact has been deleted; false, otherwise.

retrieveFact

public java.util.List<java.lang.Object> retrieveFact(int factID)
                                              throws org.nlogo.api.ExtensionException
Retrieves the fact with the specified fact ID from this fact base.

Parameters:
factID - the fact's ID
Returns:
the fact associated with the given ID
Throws:
org.nlogo.api.ExtensionException - if the fact ID is invalid or the fact with this ID was retracted or if (part of) the fact cannot be found

toList

public org.nlogo.api.LogoList toList()
Exports this fact base as a LogoList. In fact, it will be a list of lists (= facts), with the first entry being the list of field names.
